content: The official conference hotel is the Wyndham Pittsburgh University Center. Note that there are a couple other Wyndhams in Pittsburgh, so the University Center part is important! If CMU booked a hotel for you, this is where you're staying.

The Wyndham is about an hour by bus from the airport -- take the 28X to Forbes and Bigelow, and walk to the other side of the giant evil-looking tower. I think you can get a ConnectCard at the airport to pay for the buses with stored value. It's probably worth it if you expect to take the bus more than just to/from the airport. If you pay cash, the bus drivers can't make change for you, which is annoying, so get some one dollar bills at the airport. There are also taxis, Lyft, Uber, etc, which will take 30-60 minutes depending on traffic and cost $40-60.
I think a fair number of people are arriving Sunday evening, so maybe you could coordinate shared rides.

The conference is in Baker Hall A51. It's a ~15 minute walk from the hotel. Baker Hall and Porter Hall are the same building, so you can enter into either. The CMU campus topography is a little confusing, we'll try to put up signs in Porter/Baker. wyndham-baker.png
About traveling, it's probably a good time to remember to ask for an ESTA authorization if needed.
Yes, if you need an ESTA and you haven't done it yet, don't wait any longer!
These things used to be issued in just a few minutes but there's a warning on the website now saying that it can take several days

Also, if CMU was supposed to book the hotel for you and you can't find the confirmation email, search for mail from Mary Grace Joseph. Apparently the emails don't contain the name "Wyndham" in text anywhere.
Note that ESTAs are valid for two years; you can check on their website if yours is still valid

I think a fair number of people are arriving Sunday evening, so maybe you could coordinate shared rides.

This is fine, you won't be charged, things will be resolved soon, but apparently there's nobody working at the hotel over the weekend who has the power to resolve this...
Sorry for the confusion. Hopefully you won't notice anything, and everything will be resolved soon enough. Just a warning there might be a hiccup.
